FABER-002.recovery: Validate JSON syntax or restore from template

FABER-003.recovery: Run config-validate.sh for detailed errors, fix issues and retry

FABER-004.recovery: Add missing field or use a complete template (standard.json)

FABER-005.recovery: Use one of: dry-run, assist, guarded, autonomous

FABER-100.recovery: Initialize state with state-init.sh or start a new workflow

FABER-102.recovery: State file is corrupted. Restore from backup or start new workflow

FABER-103.recovery: Run state-migrate.sh to upgrade state to current version

FABER-104.recovery: Check disk space and file permissions

FABER-200.recovery: Review error details and retry phase or fix issues

FABER-201.recovery: Complete missing validation criteria before proceeding

FABER-202.recovery: Review step error details and retry or skip step if optional

FABER-203.recovery: Evaluate phase failed after max retries. Review and fix issues manually

FABER-300.recovery: Check hook configuration and executable permissions

FABER-301.recovery: Increase hook timeout or optimize hook execution

FABER-303.recovery: Verify document or script path exists

FABER-400.recovery: Run /fractary-work:init to configure work tracking integration

FABER-402.recovery: Verify work item ID exists in your work tracking system

FABER-403.recovery: Check repository permissions and branch naming

FABER-404.recovery: Check spec plugin configuration and disk space

FABER-405.recovery: Check repo permissions, branch status, and PR requirements

FABER-500.recovery: Another workflow is running. Wait or check lock status with lock-check.sh

FABER-501.recovery: Wait for other workflow to complete or manually release lock

FABER-502.recovery: Stale lock will be auto-cleaned. Retry workflow execution
